newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: Shell Malaysia signs loan deal with banks.
newsitem.headline: Shell Malaysia signs loan deal with banks.

text.p: Shell Malaysia Trading Sdn Bhd on Thursday signed a 250 million ringgit floating rate term-loan facility with Citibank Bhd, Malayan Banking Bhd (Maybank) and RHB Bank Bhd.

"The 250 million ringgit facility is to part finance the construction of the Petronas-Shell multi-product pipeline project and for Shell's investment in the expnasion and enhancement of its retail development programme," Shell said in a statement.

The five-year facility has been offered to Shell, the Malaysian unit of Royal Dutch/Shell, at a premium to Malaysian banks' base lending rate. However, the banks and the company declined to give details of the terms.
The drawn-downs of the loan begin on August 1 this year and the repayments are expected to be on July 31, 2002.
When asked why Shell was opting for a floating rate facility, a Shell official said: "We expect interest rates to move."
Shell will receive 115 milion ringgit from Maybank, 75 million from RHB Bank and 60 ringgit from Citibank.

The products marketing arm of national oil firm Petronas, Petronas Dagangan Bhd, and Shell Malaysia are building a pipeline that will connect Petronas' and Shell's refineries with the new Kuala Lumpur International Airport.
The 145-km (90-mile) multi-product pipeline will be built on an equal partnership basis in western Negeri Sembilan state.
